semantic_title: Unknown or Undetermined Intent Guidelines for External Cause Coding
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 20. Chapter 20: External Causes of Morbidity > h. Unknown or Undetermined Intent Guideline

content.full_text: If the intent (accident, self-harm, assault) of the cause of an injury or other condition is unknown or unspecified, code the intent as accidental intent. All transport accident categories assume accidental intent. (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23-L25)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding external causes when intent cannot be determined, defaulting to accidental intent (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23-L25)
key_concepts: Unknown intent defaults to accidental (Evidence: pg no: 91, L24)
Transport accidents assume accidental intent (Evidence: pg no: 91, L25)
Intent categories include accident, self-harm, and assault (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23)

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code unknown or unspecified intent as accidental intent (Evidence: pg no: 91, L24)
detailed_rules.explanation: When documentation does not specify whether an injury was intentional or accidental, the coder should default to coding it as accidental (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23-L24)

detailed_rules.rule_text: All transport accident categories assume accidental intent (Evidence: pg no: 91, L25)
detailed_rules.explanation: Transport accidents are coded as accidental by default unless specifically documented otherwise (Evidence: pg no: 91, L25)

workflow_steps: Step 1: Review documentation for intent specification
Step 2: If intent is unknown or unspecified, code as accidental
Step 3: For transport accidents, default to accidental intent

coding_scenarios.scenario: Patient presents with injury but documentation unclear about whether it was intentional or accidental
coding_scenarios.documentation_example: Patient found with head injury, circumstances unknown
step_by_step: Step 1: Review documentation for intent indicators
Step 2: Note that intent is not specified
Step 3: Code as accidental intent per guidelines

correct_coding.rationale: Unknown intent defaults to accidental per guidelines (Evidence: pg no: 91, L24)

incorrect_coding.rationale: Should not use undetermined intent unless specifically documented
incorrect_coding.common_mistake: Using undetermined intent codes when intent is simply not documented

warnings: Do not assume undetermined intent without specific documentation (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23-L24)
best_practices: Always review documentation thoroughly for intent indicators (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23)
Default to accidental when intent is unclear (Evidence: pg no: 91, L24)
common_mistakes: Using undetermined intent codes inappropriately (Evidence: pg no: 91, L23-L24)
tips: Transport accidents are always considered accidental unless documented otherwise (Evidence: pg no: 91, L25)
